sentences.text:
[MAVERICK] [THINKPAD EDGE14] System does not completely wake from suspend using lid
mage: 10.10 DVD
When suspended using the lid switch, the system does not full wake once lid is opened.
The disk spins up but the LCD never powers.
System suspends and then wakes without error
System suspends but then hangs on wake
Does closing your laptop lid cause your computer to suspend?

Re: [MAVERICK] [THINKPAD EDGE14] System does not completely wake from suspend using lid
SRU JUSTIFICATION
AMD based ThinkPad Edge 11, 13, 14 and 15 do not suspend from resume unless  acpi_skip_timer_override is set to force ignoring BIOS IRQ0 pin2 override.
This patch was tested on ThinkPad Edge 11 and 14.
and a test kernel is available at http://kernel.ubuntu.com/~manjo/maverick/lp674710/
Accepted linux into lucid-proposed, the package will build now and be available in a few hours.
Please test and give feedback here.
See https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/EnableProposed for documentation how to enable and use -proposed.
This bug is awaiting verification that the kernel in -proposed solves the problem.
Please test the kernel and update this bug with the results.
If the problem is solved, change the tag 'verification-needed' to 'verification-done'.
If verification is not done by one week from today, this fix will be dropped from the source code, and this bug will be closed.
See https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/EnableProposed for documentation how to enable and use -proposed.

Re: [MAVERICK] [THINKPAD EDGE14] System does not completely wake from suspend using lid
I can confirm that this fixes my suspend problems on an AMD64 Edge 14"!
Thanks so much for the patch.

Re: [MAVERICK] [THINKPAD EDGE14] System does not completely wake from suspend using lid
I've changed the tag from verification-needed to verification-done based off comment #5.

Re: [MAVERICK] [THINKPAD EDGE14] System does not completely wake from suspend using lid
Hi Manoj,
Please be sure to confirm this issue exists with the latest development release of Ubuntu.
ISO CD images are available from http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/daily/current/ .
However, note you can only test Suspend, not Hibernate, when using a LiveCD.
If the issue remains, run the following command from a Terminal (Applications->Accessories->Terminal) it will automatically gather and attach updated debug information to this report.
Also, please be sure to take a look at https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DebuggingKernelSuspendHibernateResume .
If you can provide any additional information outlined there it would be much appreciated.
Additionally, if you could try to reproduce this with the upstream mainline kernel that would be great.
It will allow additional upstream developers to examine the issue.
Once you've tested the upstream kernel, please remove the 'needs-upstream-testing' tag.
This can be done by clicking on the yellow pencil icon next to the tag located at the bottom of the bug description and deleting the 'needs-upstream-testing' text.
Apologies if it has reached you inappropriately;
please just reply to this message indicating so.
Accepted linux into maverick-proposed, the package will build now and be available in a few hours.
Please test and give feedback here.
See https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/EnableProposed for documentation how to enable and use -proposed.

Re: [MAVERICK] [THINKPAD EDGE14] System does not completely wake from suspend using lid
In my case (my girlfriend's, actually), a follow-up patching as discussed in <https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/kernel-team/2011-February/014500.html> was needed.

Re: [MAVERICK] [THINKPAD EDGE14] System does not completely wake from suspend using lid
I would like to confirm that the problem described by Thomas is (apparently) present on my machine 0203A16 (judging from the model number and the link it is a very similar machine).
I am currently struggling to try to port Thomas's fix for my system.

Re: [MAVERICK] [THINKPAD EDGE14] System does not completely wake from suspend using lid
This bug was fixed in the package linux - 2.6.38-4.31
* add in bugs closed by upstream patches pulled in by rebases
* [Config] enable CONFIG_VSX to allow use of vector instuctions

* SAUCE: ecryptfs: read on a directory should return EISDIR if not
    supported
* SAUCE: Dell All-In-One: Remove need for Dell module alias
* SAUCE: (drop after 2.6.38) add ricoh 0xe823 pci id.
* Quirk to fix suspend/resume on Lenovo Edge 11,13,14,15
* SAUCE: Release BTM while sleeping to avoid deadlock.

Re: [MAVERICK] [THINKPAD EDGE14] System does not completely wake from suspend using lid
I just compiled and tested a kernel with the patch from Thomas for my machine (0203A16 as mentioned above, Think Pad Edge 15") and I can confirm that it solved the problem.
I hope this model number can be included.

Re: [MAVERICK] [THINKPAD EDGE14] System does not completely wake from suspend using lid
This bug was fixed in the package linux - 2.6.35-27.48

* Revert "USB: gadget: Allow function access to device ID data during
    bind()"
* net: fix rds_iovec page count overflow, CVE-2010-3865
* Input: fix typo in keycode validation supporting large scancodes
* net: ax25: fix information leak to userland, CVE-2010-3875
* net: ax25: fix information leak to userland harder, CVE-2010-3875
* net: packet: fix information leak to userland, CVE-2010-3876
* net: tipc: fix information leak to userland, CVE-2010-3877

* posix-cpu-timers: workaround to suppress the problems with mt exec,
    CVE-2010-4248
* sys_semctl: fix kernel stack leakage, CVE-2010-4083
* thinkpad-acpi: lock down size of hotkey keymap
* thinkpad-acpi: add support for model-specific keymaps
* thinkpad-acpi: Add KEY_CAMERA (Fn-F6) for Lenovo keyboards
* x86, hotplug: Use mwait to offline a processor, fix the legacy case
* fuse: fix ioctl when server is 32bit

* ALSA: hda: Use position_fix=1 for Acer Aspire 5538 to enable capture on
    internal mic

* ALSA: hda: Use model=lg quirk for LG P1 Express to enable playback and
    capture
* drm/radeon/kms: don't apply 7xx HDP flush workaround on AGP
* drm/kms: remove spaces from connector names (v2)
* drm/radeon/kms: fix vram base calculation on rs780/rs880
* nohz: Fix printk_needs_cpu() return value on offline cpus
* nohz: Fix get_next_timer_interrupt() vs cpu hotplug
* nfsd: Fix possible BUG_ON firing in set_change_info
* NFS: Fix fcntl F_GETLK not reporting some conflicts
* sunrpc: prevent use-after-free on clearing XPT_BUSY
* hwmon: (adm1026) Allow 1 as a valid divider value

* ASoC: Fix swap of left and right channels for WM8993/4 speaker boost
    gain
* ASoC: Fix off by one error in WM8994 EQ register bank size
* ASoC: WM8580: Fix R8 initial value
* ASoC: fix deemphasis control in wm8904/55/60 codecs
* x86, xsave: Use alloc_bootmem_align() instead of alloc_bootmem()
* IB/uverbs: Handle large number of entries in poll CQ
* PM / Hibernate: Fix PM_POST_* notification with user-space suspend
* ARM: 6535/1: V6 MPCore v6_dma_inv_range and v6_dma_flush_range RWFO fix

* qla2xxx: Correct issue where NPIV-config data was not being allocated
    for 82xx parts.
* qla2xxx: Populate Command Type 6 LUN field properly.
* llc: fix a device refcount imbalance
* ath9k: Disable SWBA interrupt on remove_interface
* ath9k: fix bug in tx power
* mac80211: Fix BUG in pskb_expand_head when transmitting shared skbs

* SPARC/LEON: removed constant timer initialization as if HZ=100, now it
    reflects the value of HZ
* sparc: Pass buffer pointer all the way down to prom_{get,put}char().
* sparc: Write to prom console using indirect buffer.
* tcp: Don't change unlocked socket state in tcp_v4_err().
* tcp: Make TCP_MAXSEG minimum more correct.
* tcp: Bug fix in initialization of receive window.
* tcp: avoid a possible divide by zero
* r8169: fix sleeping while holding spinlock.
* scm: Capture the full credentials of the scm sender.
* af_unix: Allow credentials to work across user and pid namespaces.
* bridge: fix IPv6 queries for bridge multicast snooping
* cls_cgroup: Fix crash on module unload
* econet: Do the correct cleanup after an unprivileged SIOCSIFADDR.
* ifb: goto resched directly if error happens and dp->tq isn't empty
* x25: decrement netdev reference counts on unload
* net/dst: dst_dev_event() called after other notifiers
* net: Fix header size check for GSO case in recvmsg (af_packet)
* ACPICA: Fix Scope() op in module level code
* nouveau: Acknowledge HPD irq in handler, not bottom half
* printk: Fix wake_up_klogd() vs cpu hotplug
* sched: Cure more NO_HZ load average woes
* ACPI: EC: Add another dmi match entry for MSI hardware
* inotify: stop kernel memory leak on file creation failure
* orinoco: clear countermeasure setting on commit
* x86, amd: Fix panic on AMD CPU family 0x15
* md: fix bug with re-adding of partially recovered device.
* md: protect against NULL reference when waiting to start a raid10.
* tracing: Fix panic when lseek() called on "trace" opened for writing
* x86, gcc-4.6: Use gcc -m options when building vdso
* x86: Enable the intr-remap fault handling after local APIC setup
* x86, vt-d: Handle previous faults after enabling fault handling
* x86, vt-d: Fix the vt-d fault handling irq migration in the x2apic mode

* x86, vt-d: Quirk for masking vtd spec errors to platform error handling
    logic
* rt2x00: Fix max TX power settings
* USB: misc: uss720.c: add another vendor/product ID
* USB: usb-storage: unusual_devs entry for the Samsung YP-CP3
* p54usb: New USB ID for Gemtek WUBI-100GW
* n_gsm: Fix message length handling when building header

* n_gsm: gsm_data_alloc buffer allocation could fail and it is not being
    checked
* xhci: Fix issue with port array setup and buggy hosts.

* gpio: Fix null pointer dereference while accessing rdc321x
    platform_data
* cs5535-gpio: don't apply errata #36 to edge detect GPIOs
* cs5535-gpio: handle GPIO regs where higher (clear) bits are set
* mmc: at91_mci: fix multiblock SDIO transfers
* mmc: atmel-mci: fix multiblock SDIO transfers
* mmc: Fix re-probing with PM_POST_RESTORE notification
* fix freeing user_struct in user cache
* RAMOOPS: Don't overflow over non-allocated regions

* watchdog: Fix null pointer dereference while accessing rdc321x
    platform_data

* arch/x86/oprofile/op_model_amd.c: Perform initialisation on a single
    CPU
* mfd: Support additional parent IDs for wm831x
* mfd: Supply IRQ base for WM832x devices
* drm/radeon/kms/evergreen: reset the grbm blocks at resume and init
* drm/radeon/kms: reorder display resume to avoid problems

* drm/i915/dp: Fix I2C/EDID handling with active DisplayPort to DVI
    converter
* sound: Prevent buffer overflow in OSS load_mixer_volumes
* mv_xor: fix race in tasklet function
* ima: fix add LSM rule bug
* ALSA: hda: Use LPIB quirk for Dell Inspiron m101z/1120
* block: Deprecate QUEUE_FLAG_CLUSTER and use queue_limits instead

* x86/microcode: Fix double vfree() and remove redundant pointer checks
    before vfree()
* gspca - sonixj: Set the flag for some devices
* gspca - sonixj: Add a flag in the driver_info table
* mac80211: fix hard lockup in sta_addba_resp_timer_expired
* mac80211: fix mesh forwarding when ratelimited too
* mac80211: fix initialization of skb->cb in ieee80211_subif_start_xmit

* inet_diag: Make sure we actually run the same bytecode we audited,
    CVE-2010-3880
* SAUCE: ensure root is ready before running usermodehelpers in it
* SAUCE: Add WMI hotkeys support for another Dell All-In-One series
* SAUCE: Dell WMI: Use sparse keymaps and tidy up code.
* Input: i8042 - introduce 'notimeout' blacklist for Dell Vostro V13
* ACPI / Sleep: Consolidate suspend and hibernation routines
* Quirk to fix suspend/resume on Lenovo Edge 11,13,14,15
* dell-laptop: Add another Dell laptop family to the DMI whitelist
* KVM: Fix fs/gs reload oops with invalid ldt, CVE-2010-3698

* V4L/DVB: ivtvfb: prevent reading uninitialized stack memory,
    CVE-2010-4079
* tpm: fix panic caused by "tpm: Autodetect itpm devices"

Re: [MAVERICK] [THINKPAD EDGE14] System does not completely wake from suspend using lid
@Narek, @Tomas -- if you still need an additional patch after the above released versions are installed could you file another bug listing the specific hardware affected, and include a pointer to the patch.
Please add a link there to that bug so we can find it.

Re: [MAVERICK] [THINKPAD EDGE14] System does not completely wake from suspend using lid
@Andy, sorry for a late response.
No the version does not work for me and neither does the latest upstream kernel.
I had to add the patch again and recompile.
I have filed a new bug under

title: [MAVERICK] [THINKPAD EDGE14] System does not completely wake from suspend using lid
